name: Parry's Agave
climate: Parry's Agave thrives in hot desert climates with minimal humidity.
This plant can withstand temperature variations, adapting well to heat.
It prefers arid conditions, native to semi-desert areas of the Southwest.
Adapts to extreme drought conditions, typically found in dry habitats.
sunlight: Prefers full sunlight for optimal growth, needing bright, direct light.
Can tolerate partial shade, but full sun ensures healthier foliage.
Full exposure to sunlight encourages more vigorous and robust growth.
Growing in sunnier spots helps maintain its compact and dense form.
watering: Requires infrequent watering, making it ideal for xeriscaping.
Water deeply but allow soil to dry out completely between waterings.
Overwatering can lead to root rot; caution is advised in irrigation.
High drought tolerance means it thrives on neglectful watering schedules.
soil: Favors well-draining soil types, such as sandy or rocky soils.
Gravelly soil ensures proper drainage, preventing moisture accumulation.
Mix of coarse sand with loam is ideal, discouraging root rot issues.
Prefers poor, dry soils rather than rich, fertile ones for its health.
toxic: Parry's Agave can cause skin irritation upon contact with sap.
extra_care_tip: Protect from frost by using frost cloth or relocating if in containers.
